evidence.text: In 2010, Congress enacted the ACA "to increase the number of Americans covered by health insurance and decrease the cost of health care."  NFIB v.  Sebelius, 567 U.S. 519, 538 (2012).

See City ofC  olumbus, 453 F. Supp. 3d at 770.  The other opinion, from the same case, addresses the parties' cross-motions for summary judgment.  See City of Columbus v.  Cochran, 523 F. Supp. 3d 731 (D. Md. 2021).

extracted.value: City of Columbus v. Trump, 453 F. Supp. 3d 770 (D. Md. 2020)

evidence.text: "Prior  to  the  enactment  of the  ACA,  individual  health  insurance  markets  were  dysfunctional."  City of Columbus v.  Trump, 453 F. Supp. 3d 770, 778 (D. Md. 2020).1  The ACA "adopts a series of interlocking reforms designed to expand coverage in the individual health insurance market."2  King v. Burwell, 576 U.S. 473, 478-79 (2015).

Plaintiffs-three cities, a coalition of doctors, and an interest group representing small business owners-allege they will shoulder increased costs or see their members lose health insurance coverage if these changes are implemented. See generally ECF I; ECF 11 (motion for preliminary relief).

extracted.value: Plaintiffs (three cities, a coalition of doctors, and a small business interest group) allege they will shoulder increased costs or see members lose health insurance coverage if the Marketplace Integrity and Affordability Rule (Rule) takes effect on August 25, 2025. The Rule implements changes to ACA regulations related to premium subsidies, enrollment verification, and plan design.

This matter is currently before the Court on Plaintiffs' motion for a stay under 5 U.S.C. § 705 or, in the alternative, for a preliminary injunction (the 'Motion'). ECF 11. Upon consideration of the parties' filings and after a robust oral argument on the Motion, the Court GRANTS in part and DENIES in part Plaintiffs' Motion and enters a STAY enjoining certain provisions of the Rule from taking effect on August 25, 2025.

extracted.value: Plaintiffs filed motion for a stay under 5 U.S.C. § 705 or preliminary injunction (ECF 11), Defendants filed opposition (ECF 28), Plaintiffs filed reply brief (ECF 30), Court held hearing on August 14, 2025 (ECF 34).
